subject: Burlington (Vt.)--Newspapers.
Vermont--Burlington.--fast--(OCoLC)fst01207603
Vermont.title: Burlington free press.
note: Archived issues are available in digital format as part of the Library of Congress Chronicling America online collection.
Daily eds.: Daily free press (Burlington, Vt.), Apr. 1, 1848-July 9, 1868, and: Burlington daily free press (Burlington, Vt. : 1868), July 10-Dec. 31, 1868.
Editors: Luman Foote, 1827-<1832>; D.W.C. Clarke, <1850>-1853; G.W. Benedict, 1853-<1863>; G.G. Benedict, 1854-<1863>.
Issues for <July 6, 1827-> called: <volume 1, number 4->
Other weekly eds.: Times (Burlington, Vt. : 1858), 1858-1861, and: Burlington times (Burlington, Vt. : 1861), 1861-1865.
Publishers: Foote & Stacy, <1828-1832>; H.B. Stacy, <1835-1846>; D.W.C. Clarke, <1850>-1853; G.W. Benedict, 1853-<1863>; G.W. & G.G. Benedict, 1854-<1863>.
Republican. Cf. Rowell, 1869-1876.

subject: Rutland (Vt.)--Newspapers.

Vermont--Rutland.--fast--(OCoLC)fst01214597

Vermont.title: Rutland herald.
note: Also issued on microfilm from the Library of Congress, Photoduplication Service.

subject: Vermont--Newspapers.
Vermont.--fast--(OCoLC)fst01204305
Vermont.title: State journal.
note: "Vermont" appears in title ornament, May 14, 1832-Dec. 22, 1834.
Also provides comprehensive international coverage.
Anti-Masonic.
Archived issues are available in digital format as part of the Library of Congress Chronicling America online collection.
Editors: C.L. Knapp, Mr. Barber, <1835>; C.L. Knapp, 1836.
Merged with: Vermont watchman and State gazette to form: Vermont watchman and State journal.
Publisher: Chauncey L. Knapp, 1836.

subject: Constantine (Mich.)--Newspapers.
Michigan--Constantine.--fast--(OCoLC)fst01232806
Michigan--Saint Joseph County.--fast--(OCoLC)fst01210520
Saint Joseph County (Mich.)--Newspapers.
Michigan.title: Constantine republican.
note: Archived issues are available in digital format as part of the Library of Congress Chronicling America online collection.
Dec. 6, 1837 issue incorrectly dated Oct. 6.
Description based on: Vol. 1, no. 2 (July 13, 1836).
Issued advertisements only, Dec. 6-27, 1837, due to paper shortage.
Whole numbering added, Vol. 2, no. 1 (July 5, 1837) = no. 53.

subject: Carrollton (Ohio)--Newspapers.
Ohio--Carrollton.--fast--(OCoLC)fst01237591
Ohio.title: Carroll free press.
note: "Official paper of the county", 1856-1858; "County official paper", 1859-1861.
"Will ... support Whig men, Whig measures and Whig principles," June 30, 1837.
Archived issues are available in digital format from the Library of Congress Chronicling America online collection.
Suspended: Dec. 29, 1848-Mar. 16, 1849; Aug. 29-Sept. 30, 1861.
